title: Starlink reaches 250,000 subscribers as it targets aviation and other markets
summary: SpaceX now has a quarter of a million subscribers for its Starlink satellite broadband service as it looks to move into new markets like aviation.

title: James Webb teams successfully align mirror, commissioning continues
summary: Following a historic launch in December 2021 and an incredible arrival at Lagrange Point 2 (L2) in January, James Webb Space Telescope teams have been hard at work preparing the telescope for its first observations this summer. On March 16, NASA announced that one of the most critical steps in the commissioning process had been completed — the alignment of all 18 individual mirrors on James Webb’s primary mirror.

title: OneWeb signs with SpaceX to resume launching internet constellation
summary: OneWeb said Monday it has reached an agreement with SpaceX to resume launching the company’s satellite internet constellation later this year, just 18 days after suspending launches on Russian Soyuz rockets.

title: OneWeb turns to a competitor—SpaceX—to complete its constellation
summary: "We’re on track to finish building out our full fleet of satellites."

title: So how do Russian cosmonauts feel about Russia’s war on Ukraine?
summary: "Everyone that I know or have heard of supports the war."

title: OneWeb reaches launch deal with SpaceX
summary: OneWeb did not disclose how soon its SpaceX launch would happen, how many satellites it would deploy, which SpaceX launch vehicle would be used, or whether the deal includes more than one launch

title: Hope fading for recovery of European radar imaging satellite
summary: ESA officials said prospects are dimming for the recovery of a radar imaging satellite that malfunctioned nearly three months ago, but that efforts to save the spacecraft continue.

title: Plato exoplanet mission gets green light for next phase
summary: Plato, ESA’s next-generation planet hunting mission, has been given the green light to continue with its development after the critical milestone review concluded successfully on 11 January 2022.

title: Cyber warfare gets real for satellite operators
summary: The U.S. government on March 17 advised satellite operators to put their guard up in the wake of a cyberattack that disrupted internet services in Europe provided by Viasat’s KA-SAT.

title: General Dynamics’ cloud contract with NGA moves forward after Leidos withdraws protest
summary: General Dynamics won a 10-year deal with a $4.5 billion ceiling to modernize the National Geospatial Intelligence Agency's cloud infrastructure
